International Programs at Purdue (now known as CILMAR) is a division at Purdue that promotes and assesses curricular and co-curricular intercultural learning options for Purdue students, faculty, and staff while conducting cutting edge research on intercultural competency.

  • Illustration
  • Development
  • #Internship

International Programs hosts events and workshops for all students, ranging from soccer tournaments, potlucks, and even concerts.

During my time at International Programs, I helped design flyers, e-newsletters, and marketing materials to 16,000+ students and increased Facebook Page following by 60%, resulting in a 20% increase of students at events.
